Class PlayerKeyHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.PlayerKeyHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class PlayerKeyHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Takes player input and sends it to the the controller.
    Author:
    Alex Addeo, Zion Aranda, Katie Black, Michael Cisternino, Nick Hoffman

    • Method Detail

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Translates a pressed key into an in-game event. When a key is pressed, the actionlistener switches it and calls the gamecontrol method related to that action. Left and right alter the character's x velocity. Up sets the character's jump status to true and modifies the gravity so it will jump. T throws a trash bag to collect trash. H throws hay to soak up chemicals. S throws seeds to fix bare soil. C throws compost to fix bad soil. X throws oysters to fill gabions. W throws waste (trash) into trash cans. R throws recyclables into recycling bins.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The keyevent to be acted on.

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)

        Specified by:

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        When the key is released, movement is stopped.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The keyevent being acted upon.
